plots: Rachel is looking for a room and wants to move in with Phoebe , but Phoebe tells them that Phoebe already has a roommate , Denise .
Joey offers Rachel Chandler 's old room , but scares Rachel by talking about " naked Thursday " .
Rachel has a roommate named Denise that the rest of the group was not aware of .
Rachael is looking for a new place to live , and Joey offers his apartment as an option .
Phoebe startles her friends by revealing that she has a roommate named Denise .
Rachel inquires about being a friend 's roommate but learns there is n't room because Denise , a roommate that Rachel and Chandler have never heard of , already lives there .

plots: Chandler and Monica fight about what to do with Rachel 's room and Chandler 's furniture .
Monica and Chandler have a fight about what to do with the Rachel 's old room , which is spare now .
Monica and Chandler were talking about the apartment

utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Ross is entering, dragging Chandler, to mediate the argument between Chandler and Monica.]

utterances.transcript: What's all this about you guys fighting?! Is this really over a room?! I mean, that is so silly!
caption: what s all this about you guys fighting is this really over a room i mean that is so silly

utterances.transcript: Ross, we can handle this.
caption: ross we can handle this

utterances.transcript: Well, apparently not, and I can't just stand by and watch two people I care about very much be hurt over something that is so silly. I mean, enough of the silliness!
caption: well apparently not and i can t just stand by and watch two people i care about so much be hurt by something that is so silly i mean enough of the silliness

utterances.transcript: Well, why don't you tell her to stop being silly!
utterances.transcript_with_note: Well, why don't you tell her to stop being silly! (Monica mocks him and he joins in.)
caption: why don t you tell her to stop being silly

utterances.transcript: Okay-okay! Two very good points, look I've known you both a long time, and I've never seen either of you one/millionth as happy as you've been since you've got together. Do you really want to throw that all away over a room? That is so silly. Now wh-what is more important, love or silliness?
utterances.transcript_with_note: (stopping them) Okay-okay! Two very good points, look I've known you both a long time, and I've never seen either of you one/millionth as happy as you've been since you've got together. Do you really want to throw that all away over a room? That is so silly. Now wh-what is more important, love or silliness?
caption: two very good points look i ve known you both a long time and i ve never seen either of you one millionth as happy as you ve been since you got together do you really wanna throw that all away over a room

utterances.transcript: Well, we are fond of the silliness, but we also have a soft spot for the love.
caption: well we are fond of the silliness but we also have a soft spot for the love

utterances.transcript: Love is the best medicine.
caption: love is the best medicine

utterances.transcript: That's laughter.
caption: that s laughter

utterances.transcript: Why do you do it?
caption: why do you do it

utterances.transcript: I don't know.
caption: i don t know

utterances.transcript: Okay! All right! Now, Chandler you-you wanna live with Monica, right?
caption: now chandler you wanna live with monica right

utterances.transcript: Yeah, I do.
caption: yeah i do

utterances.transcript: And Mon, you wanna live with Chandler, don't ya?
caption: and mon you wanna live with chandler don t you

utterances.transcript: Yes.
caption: yes

utterances.transcript: Good! A verbal contract is binding in the state of New York!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (jumping up) Good! A verbal contract is binding in the state of New York! (Storms out.)
caption: good a verbal contract is binding in the state of new york

plots: However , Ross ( desperate to have Rachel move in with him ) convinces Monica and Chandler that it is just silly : love is more important then a stupid room , after which Monica and Chandler make up .
Monica thinks that love is the best medicine .
Ross thinks it funny that Monica is fighting over a room
Ross seeks to mediate a dispute Monica is having .

utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: Central Perk, Rachel is sitting at the counter waiting for Gunther, yep Gunther's back, to refill her coffee.]

utterances.transcript: You're never gonna believe it uh, Monica and Chandler are moving in again. That's great news right-I mean for them. Right?

utterances.transcript: Well, because of us! Because of our history.

utterances.transcript: No! Not at all!

utterances.transcript: Good! Me neither! So it's not a problem. We're just two friends who happen to be roommates.

utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Chandler is once again being dragged in by Ross so he that he can try to manipulate the situation so that it's best for Ross, not necessarily what's best for Monica and Chandler.]

utterances.transcript: So are you sure about this whole moving in thing?! I mean it's a really big step! And-and what's the rush?!

utterances.transcript: That's very funny!

utterances.transcript: He's being silly, because he knows that we enjoy the silliness!

utterances.transcript: No, I-I-I'm serious, okay? I mean, think about it. You move in, you start fighting over stupid game rooms, next thing y'know you break up!

utterances.transcript: Okay, there are no stupid fights!! This isn't about the room, this is about what the room...represents! And unfortunately, this room could destroy you!!

I just don't want to see you guys break up! Which you will do if you move in together, (Monica and Chandler just stare at him.) but that's what you want, there's nothing I can do. (Opens the door and tries one more time.) DON'T DO IT!!!!! (Finally leaves.)
